title: What Are Cognitive Biases
content: Cognitive biases are systematic patterns in thinking that deviate from rationality. They're not stupidity—they're efficient mental shortcuts that usually work but can fail predictably. Everyone has them. Awareness enables recognition and mitigation through deliberate processes.

mcq.question: Why do cognitive biases exist?

options.B: They're efficient shortcuts that usually work but fail in specific situations

mcq.explanation: Biases evolved as efficient heuristics—quick decisions that are usually good enough. They fail when situations don't match the patterns they evolved for. Understanding this prevents treating biases as personal failings and enables systematic mitigation.
